Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for the 2018 Symposium On Usable Privacy and Security (SOUPS)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Symposium On Usable Privacy and Security (SOUPS) is the top conference devoted to usable privacy and security. It brings together an interdisciplinary group of researchers and practitioners in human computer interaction, security, and privacy. The program features technical papers, workshops and tutorials, a poster session, panels and invited talks, and discussion sessions. The 14th SOUPS will be held August 12-14, 2018, in Baltimore, MD, co-located with USENIX Security. This award supports student travel to the conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This grant supported the attendance of students to the 2018 Symposium on Usable Privacy and Security (SOUPS), which took place August 12-14, 2018 in Baltimore, MD, USA. SOUPS unites an interdisciplinary group of researchers and practitioners in human computer interaction, security, and privacy. The 2018 program featured:

• Technical papers, including replication papers

• Workshops and tutorials

• A poster session

• Lightning talks

Authors submitted previously unpublished papers describing research or experience in all areas of usable privacy and security.

The criteria for selection of a student grant included conference participation, financial need, institutions not traditionally represent at USENIX events, and a supporting statement outlining the applicant's research. At this important security event, scholarship recipients were able to present research and interact with researchers in the field. Participation in SOUPS 2018 and similar conferences is a valuable and important part of the graduate school experience. It provides students with the opportunity to discuss and receive feedback on their research, and exposes students to leading edge work in the field. The support awarded through this grant enabled the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend SOUPS 2018. We received 43 applications, and awarded 21 scholarships to students enrolled at US universities.
